thread.title: MP Guy Opperman warns Tories need to back 'social justice' to win over younger voters

author: Jonathan Walker
title: MP Guy Opperman warns Tories need to back 'social justice' to win over younger voters
text:
MP Guy Opperman warns Tories need to back 'social justice' to win over younger voters Northumberland MP says Conservatives must do more to win support from 'millennials' Share Guy Opperman (Image: Newcastle Chronicle) Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Conservatives must focus more on “social justice” if they want to win over younger voters, Hexham MP Guy Opperman has warned.
He said Tories must become much better at talking to younger people and getting their message out to schools and universities.
But he also warned that Conservatives must show they are “passionate about social justice and social mobility, in a way that hasn’t been resonating in the way I would like us to.”
He was speaking in a fringe event at the Conservative conference in Birmingham, where Tories discussed how they can win back “younger” voters - which includes anyone younger than their mid-40s, Read More Huge applause for Boris Johnson as he sets out leadership pitch at Conservative conference
Studies and polling suggest that while support for Labour or the Conservatives used to be associated with social class, it’s now increasingly connected to age with younger voters attracted to Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour Party.
Mr Opperman suggested voters didn’t want to hear more arguments about Brexit deals, saying: “What the vast majority of my voters are interested in is, what kind of country are we going to be like post-Brexit?
“I believe passionately we should be a progressive one nation, open, inclusive country.” Read More
